diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) with secondary hemophagocytic syndrome
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of SLE was established based on positive antinuclear and anti-dsDNA antibodies, along with clinical manifestations of fever, abdominal pain, proteinuria, and pan-cytopenia. The secondary hemophagocytic syndrome was identified due to the presence of fever, hypertriglyceridemia, hypofibrinogenemia, hyperferritinemia, and bone marrow findings indicating hemophagocytosis.
